Key Match Events: Mark Vientos hit a pair of book-end two-run homers, including one to tie things in the ninth.
The Phillies had some ninth-inning magic of their own, as Nick Castellanos hit a walk-off single to give Philly the win and tie the series 1-1.
Tylor Megill surrendered a walk-off RBI single to Nick Castellanos in the bottom of the inning, sending the Mets to a 7-6 loss to the Phillies in Game 2 of the NLDS at Citizens Bank Park.
Pre-Game Insights: Luis Severino is slated to get the start for the Mets against Phillies lefty Cristopher Sánchez in Game 2, which starts at 4:08 p.m. ET at Citizens Bank Park.
Will the Phillies bounce back to even the series, or will the Mets take a 2-0 heading back to Citi Field?
Post-Match Reflections: Carlos Mendoza: Mets will be ready for Game 3 at home after heartbreaker
The series is tied at 1-1 and going back to Queens in what has been a wild NLDS.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Mark Vientos is the Mets’ main man right now
This has almost become routine for the Mets.
The Mets right-hander won Game 1 of the NL Wild Card Series, allowing four runs over six innings against the Brewers.
Others: The Mets and Phillies are back for Game 2 of the NLDS after a thrilling Game 1.
The Amazin’s used another late rally — with five runs in the eighth inning — to take Game 1, 6-2.
